result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesus Tejeda

records.addlTxt:
1:41 PM Defendant Jesus Tejeda appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Jesus Tejeda. Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 21CF54, 22CF43 & 22TR330. Magallones would like 21CF54 set for a 2 day trial. Bond continued. adj. 01:44 PM
Jury trial scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

3:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jesus Tejeda appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Jesus Tejeda. Calling 21CF54, 22CF43 & 22TR330. Court review of case. Sowinski states blood tests resolved have been received - statement to negotiations - would like to set out. Magallones in agreement. Bond continued. adj. 03:35 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesus Tejeda appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Jesus Tejeda. Calling 21CF54, 22CF43 & 22TR330. Magallones states has not received lab results - would like jury trial taken off. Sowinski is in agreement - not sure when results would be back - statement to Defendant prior JOC's - has not received. Court will take trial off. Bond continued. adj. 03:45 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

2:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jesus Tejeda appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Breanna Magallones in court for Jesus Tejeda. Calling 21CF54, 22CF43 & 22TR330. Magallones states cases are not resolved - waiting for test results - would like to set for Jury Trial - statement to bond. Sowinski states some results have been received - they are incomplete - offer was made - would like to set out 30 days - objects to amend bond. Court will not readdress bond at this point. Court will set for 1 day trial. Bond continued. adj. 02:39 PM
Jury trial scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection
Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
04:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jesus Tejeda appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Breanna Magallones appeared in court for Jesus Tejeda. Calling 21CF54, 21CF206, 21CF265, 21CM54, 21CM3, 22CF43, 22TR330, 21TR2001 & 21TR1 - 21TR3. 22CF43 Set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Magallones willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Sowinski statement to motions filed on bond. Magallones statement to bond. Court amends bond in 21CF106 to $5000 cash - 21CM2 to $500 cash and 21CM3 to $1000 cash - all conditions remain - Bonds continued in other cases. adj. 04:11 PM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:24 PM Prosecuting attorney Mary M Sowinski appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jesus Tejeda appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Breanna Magallones appeared in court. Calling 22CF43, 21CF54, 21CF206, 21CF265, 21CM3, 21TR1, 21TR2, 21TR201 & 22TR330. 22CF43 set for an Initial Appearance. Magallones states Defendant needs to apply for PD and may represent is accepted. In receipt of complaint, right to counsel. Sowinski/Magallones statement to bail. Court sets bond. Defendant statement to no contact order. Sowinski statement to victim/no contact. adj. 01:40 PM
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 22, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
